title: I have reason to believe a player in this game was scripting.
body:
I won't say which one but i was the Xerath, my lane opponent would begin to Zigzag in the same exact pattern every single time i hovered my mouse over him. If i were to try and cast my Q, he would zigzag in the same direction, every single time. I could understand simply Zigzaging while a Xerath is casting Q, but to do it so perfectly in line with the Hitbox is obviously a script.

I think it's funny because Xerath(the most scripted on champ) is the easiest champ to find scripter's on. Holding down his Q and watching someone move like that, right in line with your mouse and the hitbox of your Q is so funny.

replies.body:
I doubt a low silver player scripts, on top of that being a normal. Maybe he was just lucky.

We can't tell if he was scripting based on the matchhistory, we would need a video and it would need to be quite obvious.
I would argue a low silver player is more likely to script.
They would not continue to be low silver should they script. Perhaps you just are a little rusty ?

scripts mainly help with your laning phase. It doesn't help play the game for you. So if a bronzie is scripting, his laning phase may bring him up to gold tier, but he doesn't know how to press his advantage nor play the macro game, so he'll just end up being in silver.
Exactly, I found more scripters playing on my bronze-silver smurfs than I ever did on my main.

Sorry bro, the community forums is not the right place to report someone. Please submit a ticket to https://support.riotgames.com instead.

In the mean while, please remove that match history from your post as it is against the forum's "Naming and shaming" rule.

Scripters are typically banned in waves, so it may look like that nothing is happening to him for a period of time, but if he was scripting, he can't hide it.
I didn't name him, that's why i didn't give the name. Buuuut i guess i'll remove it anyway, not like posting to the boards helps when getting a scripter banned.

I am not exactly well informed on how scripts work, but I am fairly sure that they cannot see where your mouse is or where you target spells until you fire them. That information probably isn't even sent to the server, that would just be useless information that the server would have to process and that would take up bandwidth. Mouse clicks are, since those have the potential to cause an action to happen, but just where your mouse is at any given time isn't.

Humans are creatures of habit. It makes sense that someone would perform the same actions over and over until something happens to cause him to think that it was harmful to his survival or objective. Almost everyone has small habits like that.

Yeah, it never moved away from his mouse before he pressed any buttons, which is what you seem to be claiming someone did in your post.

There are parts in that where Redmercy was hovering his mouse over the scripter's character and it didn't move at all.
